UAVariable.Description: Actual value of the monitored parameter
The start-up alarm suppression deactivates alarms of a monitored parameter during start up or a setpoint jump
Determination if monitoring tolerance parameters are determined by auto-tuning itself (TRUE) or can be manually adjusted (FALSE)

UAObject.Description: With this type the client can do settings for the closed loop control on the device for a parameter

UAVariable.Description: Determination if PID Parameters are determined by auto-tuning itself (TRUE) or can be manually adjusted (FALSE)
Informs if the automatic tuning is currently active

UAMethod.Description: Stops an already active self-optimisation process (no control parameters are changed)
Starts the self-optimisation of the controller

UAVariable.Description: PID Parameters as array if several input signals (sensors) are used for the control
Lower relative tolerance value of the process parameter
Second lower relative tolerance value of the process parameter
Additional information on the necessary maintenance. Can be also a link to another document.
Regular interval between two maintenances
Interval before next maintenance is due

UAMethod.Description: This Method sets the CurrentInterval to 0 and Status to NOT_DUE_0

UAVariable.Description: Maintenance status of the machine/device/component (represented by the parent element)
How long is the component running in total
Maximum absolute value of the process parameter
Minimum absolute value of the process parameter
Defines how closely the tolerances are set during the automatic limit setting

UAMethod.Description: With this method the tolerance values are set according to the actual value and the set monitoring sensitivity

UAVariable.Description: Indication if SetValue that is lower than the actual value shall be reached as fast as possible (SetRampDown = 0) or within a given value change per time
Indication if a SetValue that is higher than the actual value shall be reached as fast as possible (SetRampUp = 0) or within a given value change per time

Actual value of the monitored parameter
The start-up alarm suppression deactivates alarms of a monitored parameter during start up or a setpoint jump
Determination if monitoring tolerance parameters are determined by auto-tuning itself (TRUE) or can be manually adjusted (FALSE)

UAObject.Description: With this type the client can do settings for the closed loop control on the device for a parameter

UAVariable.Description: Determination if PID Parameters are determined by auto-tuning itself (TRUE) or can be manually adjusted (FALSE)
Informs if the automatic tuning is currently active

UAMethod.Description: Stops an already active self-optimisation process (no control parameters are changed)
Starts the self-optimisation of the controller

UAVariable.Description: PID Parameters as array if several input signals (sensors) are used for the control
Lower relative tolerance value of the process parameter
Second lower relative tolerance value of the process parameter
Additional information on the necessary maintenance. Can be also a link to another document.
Regular interval between two maintenances
Interval before next maintenance is due

UAMethod.Description: This Method sets the CurrentInterval to 0 and Status to NOT_DUE_0

UAVariable.Description: Maintenance status of the machine/device/component (represented by the parent element)
How long is the component running in total
Maximum absolute value of the process parameter
Minimum absolute value of the process parameter
Defines how closely the tolerances are set during the automatic limit setting

UAMethod.Description: With this method the tolerance values are set according to the actual value and the set monitoring sensitivity

UAVariable.Description: Indication if SetValue that is lower than the actual value shall be reached as fast as possible (SetRampDown = 0) or within a given value change per time
Indication if a SetValue that is higher than the actual value shall be reached as fast as possible (SetRampUp = 0) or within a given value change per time
Set/nominal/target value of the monitored parameter
